title: Software meets eDrive Electrifying Insights @Mercedes-Benz Cars
description:
The future of mobility is electric, digital and intelligent - characteristics that EQ stands for at Mercedes-Benz.

EQ's portfolio includes all future battery-powered automobiles as well as the associated products and services from Mercedes-Benz. In the electrification of the powertrain, Mercedes-Benz is taking a holistic approach and developed the EQ brand with a vehicle family and an ecosystem that includes a comprehensive range of electric mobility products in addition to the vehicle itself. The EQ team invites you to Sindelfingen on May 11, 2019 and looks forward to taking a look into the future of Mercedes-Benz Cars together with you!

What awaits you?

Our EQ experts are looking forward to getting to know you at our event "Software meets eDrive" on May 11, 2019 in Sindelfingen. We want to discuss the electrifying future of Mercedes-Benz Cars with you and give you insights into our ideas and projects. In addition to pitches on current top topics, information stands and discussion forums, you will have the opportunity to talk to our experts from Research & Development in private to exchange ideas, challenges and fields of application in Stuttgart and Berlin.

Interested?

Our experts will be on site in Sindelfingen on May 11, 2019 and look forward to discussing the following topics with you:

▸ Software development eDrive

▸ Battery and cell development

Good to know

If your application is successful, we will invite you before May 4. We will cover the cost of travel to and from the event. If you are unable to attend on the day of the event, we will be happy to contact you by Skype or telephone.

We look forward to hearing from you!
how_to_apply: Take a look into the future of Mercedes-Benz Cars together with us and apply here!

title: Senior Graphics Developer
description:
We are looking for a senior graphics developer to welcome in our central team in either London or Barcelona to help us push the graphical quality of our mobile games. Are you someone with experience of delivering scalable systems and do you like to work closely with amazingly skillful Artists to deliver beautiful results that push the boundaries of what people consider possible on mobile? If so, we’d really like to hear from you.

Your Role within our Kingdom

As part of the Central Art group:

  • You'll work alongside hardworking and passionate Artists and Technical Artists on key technologies to deliver cutting edge visuals that will be used across a variety of titles at King.
  • You will also work with key developers across King to share knowledge and top practices helping to ensure when a game is released, the visuals standout.
  • You will work in a highly visible role with the chance to make significant impact on the mobile games market.
  • You will be at the cutting edge of helping define and research the best techniques that allow the best use of the mobile GPU hardware.

Skills to Create Skills

  • You are a forward-thinker with a desire to help define the top practices on the rapidly evolving mobile GPU ecosystem.
  • You are curious and have the ability to learn quickly, and you love working closely with others to tear down the boundaries.
  • You are fascinated by GPU architecture and appreciate the growing opportunity this rapidly evolving landscape presents.
  • You possess excellent C++ knowledge
  • You have professional experience of game development
  • You hold experience in delivering scalable graphic solutions
  • You show a real passion for game development
  • You demonstrate high sense of quality and passion for all things graphical
  • You're a good communicator, with artist and programmers alike

Bonus Points

  • You have mobile GPU architecture knowledge
  • You have experience in generating procedural systems
  • You are experienced in working with Unity
  • You know a little about Android/OSX
  • You have tile-based GPU rendering knowledge

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun! Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. And that’s it.

Life at King

Officially, we are a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world. Unofficially, we’re a serious business that takes pride in having fun. Every single day at King, we mix intuition with logic, art with science and magic with mathematics to craft the games the world loves to play. Together with our parent company, Activision Blizzard, our mission is to bring moments of magic to everyday life. Do you think this is something you can help us achieve? Then we’d love to talk.

Comprehensive relocation package

People come from all over the world to work with us, and we want every single one of them to feel at home. To do so, you will receive as much help as we can give you with our relocation package. You can enjoy full visa sponsorship for you and any family member moving with you; you can see covered the cost your journey out here, of shipping your gadgets; and you can receive further help with estate agents.

title: Senior C++ Developer – Candy Crush Franchise
description:
We are looking for a talented C++ Developer to join one of the world's biggest live game franchises - Candy Crush!

Your role within our Kingdom

If you want to create amazing user experiences and entertainment for millions of players to enjoy on the go then this is the right job for you. title: Developer Relations Engineer – Game Engine
description:
We are looking for a passionate developer to join our team in Stockholm. You will be a part of our game engine Developer Relation team with the mission to help game teams work efficiently with the engine. You will be working in a dynamic environment with active problem solving through collaboration with various teams.

Your role within our Kingdom

As part of the developer relations team, you will be a critical part of educating our game teams about our internal C++ engine. You will provide hands-on support to get the best out of the game engine in a new game production, whether it’s troubleshooting, profiling or education on existing features. In order to do this, a big part of your time will be spent creating tech demos, documentation, tutorials and extensions that help our users get started and learn all our best practices.

This help can be provided through remote support, production of training material or on-site.

You will among other things:

  • Be available to provide support for game teams, both in person and remotely. Teams are located at all our engineering offices.
  • Help game teams to keep up to date with the latest engine features
  • Provide engine team "from the field" feedback and feature recommendations
  • Create training/documentation material around game engine and tools.

Skills to create thrills

  • Collaborative person that communicates well with internal customers
  • Excellent programming skills in C++
  • Passionate about supporting game teams
  • Experience working in game development with commercial engines
  • Experience creating and maintaining technical documentation
  • Available to travel when necessary

Bonus points

  • Experience in a similar advocate/developer relation/support role
  • Experience working with game engines
  • Knowledge of Java or Objective C
  • Experience working with Python and Bash scripting

title: Data Scientist Technical Lead
description:
We are looking for a talented and creative Data Scientist Technical Lead who is interested in pushing the boundaries of online games analytics, with a proven ability to apply your skills, be it technical, behavioural or economic, practically in order to generate business value.

Your role within our Kingdom

The London Business Performance Unit is part of King London Studio, home to our live games - Farm Heroes Saga and Farm Heroes Super Saga as well as our new games in production, supporting King’s network of hundreds of millions of players. We are focused on building games that our players love. Reporting to the Business Performance Director of the London Business Performance Unit, you will lead a team of 4-6 Data Scientists of various tenure and Data Science Team Leads. You will be part of a community of 80+ business intelligence & analytics experts across King.

What you’ll do:

  • Analyse our games per business needs
  • Continuously develop your team’s skillset through the Data Science Team Lead, trainings, coaching, peer reviews and other means as you see fit
  • Proactively develop and define new analyses, experiments, data-driven tools, methodologies and best practices to advance data science methods within the team in order to better understand our players’ behaviour and the performance of our games
  • Lead recruitment and onboarding of Data Scientists
  • Identify and oversee or handle data and technical issues and projects
  • Keeping up to date with industry and DS best practices, methodologies and evangelising with the team as relevant
  • Identify analysis that should be prioritised and work with stakeholders to prioritise it
  • Be part of King DS leadership forum, evangelise the team and connect the team to the wider DS community in King
  • Define the tech strategy including automation, tools preference, coding best practices, reusability and transferability
  • Support other London BPU team members from technical and methodology perspective Skills to create thrills

You have a passion for quantitative analysis and will have the ability to draw business insights which will add real value to King. You will need to demonstrate the ability to learn quickly and will have worked in a fast paced and collaborative environment. This role will involve working with teams and individuals within the studio and across King - such as Game Developers, Designers and Business Performance Managers, so excellent communication skills are essential.

Our ideal candidate will have solid experience leading an analytical team in a commercial environment.

Business Insight: The ability to understand the problems and opportunities from a player and a business perspective, and then defining the right data, analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisions

Leadership: The ability to mentor, guide and inspire Data Scientists and drive best practices

SQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with 300+ million players, and work effectively with big data technologies, e.g. BigQuery, Hadoop etc..

Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python (and also Excel) for analytical purposes

Stats: Understanding the appropriate statistical or machine learning techniques to use in different circumstances.

Communication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous

Bonus points

Specific experience that might be helpful, but is not required, includes: experience in the games industry or similarly sophisticated customer-facing digital businesses; experience in behavioural psychology/economics; robust understanding of more advanced statistical techniques suitable for analysis of highly skewed populations; experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas; experience in experimental design; software engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R and Python which we use most frequently); skills with standard reporting tools such as QlikView/Tableau/etc.

A great saga needs all sorts of heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. And that’s it.

King in London

Based in bustling Soho, the cultural heart of the West End, our London studio occupies all four floors of the landmark Ampersand building. Regent’s Park is close enough for a lunchtime run, as are the delights of Covent Garden and the shopping mecca Oxford Street. Non-Brits will soon discover it’s no urban myth; there really is a pub on every corner.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
We are looking for a talented and creative Data Scientist interested in pushing the boundaries of games analytics within the Farm Heroes Franchise located in our London Game studio. You’ll have a proven ability to apply your skills, be it technical, behavioural or economic, to generate value for the studio's new generation of awesome mobile games.

You will be working with varied stakeholders in a fun, dynamic and fast-paced environment. You’ll help us to further understand, model, predict, segment and retain our players and be part of a community of 100+ business intelligence & analytics experts.

Specifically, you’ll:

  • Proactively develop new analyses, experiments and data-driven tools to better understand our players’ behaviour and the performance of our games
  • Provide insights to support decision making for the portfolio of games in the Studio
  • Translate business needs to technical requirements and AB-tests, and work with development teams to ensure correct implementation, taking care to correctly track the right information to allow easy, precise analysis of the impact
  • Work closely with other Data Scientists across the business to leverage insights from one game across multiple games
  • Carefully check, debug, and problem solve issues to ensure you deliver accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools, even when confronted by subtle data complications

There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.

Specific factors that are helpful to excel in this role include:

  • Business Insight: The ability to understand the problems and issues our games and business wants to solve, and then defining the right data, analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisions
  • Communication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous
  • SQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with 300+ million players and work with relational database systems.
  • Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python or Excel for analytical purposes
  • Stats: Understanding the basics of appropriate statistical or machine learning techniques.

Other experience that might be helpful, but is not required, includes:

  • Work in the games industry or similarly customer-facing digital businesses
  • Familiarity with massive data sets and tools to deal with them (BigQuery/AWS/Hadoop etc)
  • Experience in behavioural psychology/economics and experimental design
  • Experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas
  • Software engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R and Python which we use most frequently)
  • Skills with standard reporting tools such as Looker/QlikView/Tableau/etc.

We're Knights of Creativity

We believe that great gaming experiences happen when they are developed by working in small, autonomous creative teams that control the whole process - from idea to amazing game. Our close connection with the player community gets us instant feedback and enables us to deliver truly magical moments. We value your free time and your need to refuel, relax and find inspiration - by playing games with your colleagues, being at home with your family or going to the gym or out for a run. That's how we stay creative. That’s why we call ourselves developers of magic and knights of creativity! Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people that share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. No matter where you’re from, it’s all about what we can achieve together when creating truly magical moments for all our players. That’s why we hire all sorts of talent - because a great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

title: Next Big Thing - Recruiting Days Autonomous Driving and Artificial Intelligence
description:
Tasks

Is it your goal to create the Next Big Thing?

Do you immediately think of robotics, simulation platforms or software architecture? Or do you perhaps enjoy developing algorithms for autonomous systems, and programming with C/C++ and MATLAB/Simulink? Would you like to connect the vehicles of the future using cloud-based systems, and allow them to drive completely autonomously using machine learning?

Then you've come to the right place, because that is exactly what we are working on at Daimler in order to initiate a new era of mobility. Become part of this new mobility, and create your very own next big thing.

Do you have visions and ideas for how to revolutionize personal, goods or public transportation?

Then join us at the "Next Big Thing Recruiting Days Autonomous Driving and Artificial Intelligence at Daimler" on May 17 and 18 and find out what it means to work on the Next Big Thing at Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler Trucks and Daimler Buses.

An action-filled event awaits you:

  • In battles and pitches, Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler Trucks and Daimler Buses will attempt to win you for themselves.
  • You will have the opportunity to experience and discuss modern AI technology first-hand with our developers at driving events.
  • In a relaxed atmosphere, you will have the opportunity to discuss the Next Big Thing in the fields of autonomous driving and AI with your new colleagues.

Submit your application by April 29, 2019!

  • Software & architecture development in the field of cloud computing, AI, data science and DevOps
  • Software development in the area of simulation and validation processes
  • Software Development in the area of localization/positioning

Qualifications

  • You have well-developed skills with programming languages (e.g. C, C++, Python, Java) and development/simulation tools (e.g. Matlab, Simulink, DOORS, Linux).
  • You ideally already have professional experience in the fields of automated driving, driver assistance systems or electronic vehicle systems.
  • We also expect excellent communication skills and that you enjoy working in a team, as well as the ability to always keep the bigger picture in mind.

To strengthen our growing QA team, we are looking for you at our Munich location as a

Quality Assurance Engineer Mobile Apps (m/f/d)

at the earliest possible date | permanent employment | full-time employment

An exciting task awaits you with us

Would you like to take responsibility for the quality of our native mobile products (iOS & Android)? You bring this with you as Quality Assurance Engineer Mobile Apps (m/w/d)

title: Senior PHP Developer
description:
Build and improve a product that helps companies attract more qualified applicants, using a data-driven recommendation engine, that’s what Engineering at VONQ does. We are a growing organization in the transition to a software-driven business, and YOU can make an impact on that! You are a true PHP expert and you get excited when it comes to practices such as domain driven design, event sourcing & CQRS. Sounds like you? Apply now at VONQ for the position of Senior Software Engineer in Rotterdam!

Senior PHP Developer

Rotterdam, 32-40 hr, ASAP

Your every day in a nutshell

You start your day with your colleagues around the team board discussing what the goal for today should be. It seems that having the backend endpoint ready for the new API is tops, so you get down to it.

After a small design conversation, it's clear that some refactoring needs to happen, as our understanding of the problem improved. No worries! You're ready to pair up and have that PR before lunch.

In the afternoon you have a one-on-one with the CTO, Bart, and you discuss to which industry-related event you'd like to go next. Perhaps you dare to give a presentation this time?

After that, you get to check some Pull Requests made by your colleagues and before the day ends, that endpoint is building, deploying and sending the right metrics! Today's been a good day, now ready to go home.

How you get the job done

  • PHP is your native language and you use Symfony, MySQL and Elasticsearch
  • You’ll work in a multidisciplinary team: pairing, code reviews and giving/receiving feedback is something you’ll do regularly
  • Your job includes more than only coding, that’s why you’ll work closely together with the Product Manager & Business stakeholders to actually give direction to the things you build
  • Since you get a lot of space and freedom for new initiatives, you turn good ideas into actions. For example, improving or implementing things you find important or interesting on the spot!

You will be part of an international and experienced Engineering department consisting of Frontend- and Backend Developers, Data- and DevOps Engineers, an Agile Coach and a CTO.

What our perfect picture looks like

This describes the ideal candidate, but above all, we value people that are eager to grow, autonomous, work together, and love to get things done! Furthermore, we think you need:

  • 5+ year working experience as a PHP expert and an Agile mindset
  • Experience with MySQL
  • Experience with practices such as Domain Driven Design, Test-driven Development, Continuous- Integration, Deployment & Delivery
  • Excellent English communication skills
  • A passion for software architecture & craftsmanship

Bonus points:

  • Experience with event sourcing and CQRS
  • Experience with Symfony and Elasticsearch
  • Experience with REST API design and API based business
  • Experience as Scrum Master or team lead

There is more! We offer:

  • A good salary and 8% holiday allowance
  • 100% commuting expenses compensation
  • Flexible working hours
  • Unlimited (paid!) holidays
  • Pension contribution
  • Time and budget for training, and more!

Oh, and we have legendary company outings, beers on Friday and a lot of FUN!

Are you ready to make an impact and build together with us on a dream product for recruitment marketing? We can’t wait for your application!

Apply for Senior Software Engineer at VONQ in Rotterdam by clicking on this link. Questions? Reach out to Sarah (Recruiter) -> sarahellithy@vonq.com.

Agencies hold your horses: unsolicited CV’s are dropped by our SPAM filters.

title: ***Ionic / Angular Developer***
description:
Educator.com is a video based learning website popular amongst high school and college students. We are currently in the process of launching a new open learning system and are looking to improve our current mobile app.

We are looking for experienced developers to creating pixel-perfect web pages and/or apps using Ionic / Angular.

You will be working remotely but engage in continuous periods of development and testing of the code with our team. All work and progress will be updated on our GitHub repo for the team to review.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

We have 3 concurrently ongoing projects you can choose from.

  • Project #1: The first project is for completing the open learning platform, where teachers can create their own courses and post video lectures and other lesson material. The basic framework of the site is in progress, and your job will be to build on the existing code and complete all the features. The site is at https://opencourse.educator.com. Login access will be provided for you upon request.

  • Project #2: The second project is to complete the login, signup and subscription features in our mobile app (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.educator.app, https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.educator.app). After that the open learning platform mentioned above will be added to the app. You will also have a lot of opportunities for improving and adding features to the app.

  • Project #3: The third project is restructuring our company Wordpress blogs. Educator.com currently have the following Wordpress blogs and we need to merge all of them together into a single Wordpress.

https://www.educator.com/news/ https://www.educator.com/studyguide/ https://www.educator.com/college-reviews/

  • https://www.educator.com/charter-schools/
  • https://www.educator.com/study-abroad/
  • https://www.educator.com/technology/
  • https://www.educator.com/student-finance/

It's your job to analyze the content structure and decide best to merge all the blogs. We will provide you the final Wordpress theme in image form, you will create the theme and merge all of our current blogs. The fix payout for this project is $2,300USD + additional bonuses

All 3 projects are on GitHub; you will be provided access, and all your changes will be reviewed there. You will install the existing code and framework on your local system and test all changes there before pushing to the repo. Both projects are built on Ionic 3 with Angular, with a PHP backend, using the aMember membership system hosted on the main www.educator.com site.

Please send links with examples of any relevant projects you've worked on as well as your resume.

Independent developers are preferred. Companies/agencies, please excuse.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Experience with the Ionic/Angular framework as well as HTML, CSS, JS and PHP.
  • Knowledge or experience of video upload and processing.
  • Ability to create quick-responding complex user interfaces.
  • Creative solutions to improve the user experience.
  • Some knowledge or experience of progressive web apps.
  • Attention to detail

JOB BENEFITS:

  • Your contribution will be massively felt by students on Educator.com.
  • You will work directly with the founder and senior developers of the company.
  • Financial compensation can be paid by hourly, fixed or by salary depending on the collaborative chemistry.
  • No corporate BS and politics.
  • Freedom to do your thing and work remotely from anywhere and set your own hours.

You can apply for this opportunity here only: https://www.educator.com/careers/ionic

title: Mid- to Senior-level Vue.js Developer
description:
About the Position

Do you have solid Vue.js chops and are looking to put them to the test on a complex, large-scale project? Do you want to contribute to and develop architectural solutions from the ground-level? If you love making things work seamlessly and efficiently with one another, then we’re looking for you! We’re looking for a mid- to senior-level Vue.js Developer to be a key player in one of our company’s most critical initiatives, our platform conversion to Vue.js. You’ll be a vital resource on our highly-collaborative Development team, building robust scalable solutions that push the limits and can handle an endless supply of data that’s consumed by many different websites, client apps, mobile apps, Alexa, customers, vendors, etc. in real-time.

Job responsibilities include:

-Works within a highly collaborative team with senior members of our team, including our CTO, to develop a large-scale Vue.js application.

-Solves architectural challenges for a large-scale application involving a high-level of customer configurability, multiple user-types, multi-language support and more by conducting research on and experiments with alternate solutions to present recommendations.

-Designs and develops high-quality code that exhibits excellent performance, meets product requirements, and focuses on scalability and maintainability.

-Shows excellent judgment in architecting and planning applications and features at all stages of the project lifecycle.

-Interacts effectively with senior members of our team to determine project needs and develop solutions.

-Takes overall accountability for keeping the project clean and organized. This includes identifying next steps, clarifying unclear tasks, and breaking larger tasks into smaller and more manageable tasks.

-Exercises a sense of ownership to get things done. Do whatever it takes to make things happen and proactively gives advance warning if things aren’t going well so we can arrange for help.

-Constantly improves software quality (evaluate and incorporate new libraries, tools, and technologies; code reviews; refactoring; testing; etc.).

About You

-5+ years of development experience.

-2+ years with Vue.js with proven experience working on multiple complex projects.

-2 to 3 years of experience with application design/architecture.

-Previous experience working across JavaScript frameworks a plus.

-Demonstrates EXEMPLARY communication skills (both written and verbal).

-Fluent in English.

-An EXTRAORDINARY creative and analytical problem solver.

-Possesses and demonstrates PHENOMENAL overall technical expertise.

-Demonstrates a sense of urgency.

-Self-motivated, has a love for learning and new technology, and able to lead and mentor others.

-Experience with unit and end-to-end testing.

-IMPECCABLE attention to detail.

-Familiar with Agile development methodologies.

-Experience working on a B2B SaaS platform within a startup environment preferred.

Experience on the following is a plus:

-Nuxt.js -Documenting code and APIs.

-Code quality/unification (ESLint / Prettier).

-Code optimization and performance.

-Developing cross-platform applications.

We’d love it if you develop/contribute to open source!

What BuildingLink Can Offer You

-Opportunities to learn and advance your career

-Office culture comparable to the fast-pace, energy, and vibrancy of a startup, while maintaining the feel of a family owned company

-Competitive salary

-Medical/Dental/Commuter Benefits

-401k with matching

-Flexible PTO

-Birthday Holiday

-Team outings (happy hours, company events & retreats, weekly lunches, holiday parties, etc.)

About Us

BuildingLink is an industry leading property management technology used by over 4,800 high-rise residential communities globally. As an industry pioneer and leading innovator, our solutions, service, and people have made us one of the most recognized and respected technology providers among property managers and staff, condo/coop boards, and landlords. Our roadmap is packed with new and exciting initiatives to help buildings run even better. Resident lifestyle, voice assistant with our Amazon Alexa Skill; Ledger for simplified property management accounting, more platform integrations, and IoT sensor solutions to target and solve buildings’ operational headaches are just a few of the key initiatives we have in the pipeline. So, if you’re looking to work for a dynamic and successful company that cares deeply for both its customers and employees, please apply!

BuildingLink is an equal opportunity employer to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, disability, race, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other protected class by federal, state or local law.

Frontend Developer (f/m/d)

  • implementing modern front-end principles through open web standards and modern web technology to ensure the best user experience across different end devices.
  • collaborating closely with our web marketing executives by offering advice and assistance with creating concepts, with a good eye for detail.
  • working with version control to fix bugs and conflicts as new features are rolled out on the website. constantly improving the performance of our applications, while keeping an eye on the impact of your work on them.
  • optimising our digital channels and maintaining ongoing exchange with our international teams.
  • expanding our automated release process (CI) and quality assurance.

You are ...

  • enthusiastic about sport.
  • a front-end developer with a degree in Computer Science or a background in which you have successfully completed comparable training.
  • familiar with responsive design and digital media, with an eye for creative aesthetics.
  • familiar with agile working methods, e.g. Scrum, for the efficient implementation of innovative web front ends using HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript (ES5/6).
  • familiar with single-page application frameworks such as Angular or React, or have experience working with server- side JavaScript.
  • experienced with APIs such as REST.
  • motivated by challenges and teamwork.
  • proactive, results-oriented, independent.
  • good at communicating, with good to very good English skills. German is not a must have.

We are looking forward to receiving your application, with a selection of your best work.

Apply now via the application form or at: www.decathlon-karriere.de

Click here for the application form!

title: Web and UI Developer
description:
Web and UI Developer 1133 Connecticut Ave NW, Washington, DC 20036, USA Full-time

Company Description

RockCreek is a leading global investment management firm that applies data-driven technology and innovation to investing. Its portfolio managers invest in emerging markets and alternatives, and its asset allocation teams invest in multi-asset class and outsourced CIO portfolios and customized solutions. RockCreek’s client base is made up of sophisticated institutional investors, including endowments, foundations, pension plans, and sovereign funds. The firm is highly focused on the integration of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors and sustainable impact across portfolios to generate long-term returns. RockCreek has a culture of diversity, debate and relentless drive to excel.

While our core competency is investment, we value our technology as a key part of our service offerings. We are currently redesigning our website to use best-of-breed technologies and a staging and production platform. We also have a growing suite of applications that will need a unified, consistent, and user-focused approach to UX and UI.

Job Description

RockCreek is looking for a Web and UI Designer to provide a meaningful connection between the company’s public-facing website, internal Intranet, and suite of applications. This role will be responsible for recommending and implementing a web CMS solution, designing and implementing both a staging and production version of a new company website, developing a company Intranet presence, and working with the engineering team to provide consistent designs and front-ends across all of our applications. This will role also frequently communicate with users and stakeholders of our various applications.

The successful Web and UI Developer should:

  • Enjoy the process of visual and material design, as well as implementing those designs in responsive HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Model user’s behavior with wireframes and mockups using creative and modern best practices and design patterns
  • Be fluent in modern web abstractions for CSS and JavaScript, and desire to grow in an understanding and usage of JavaScript in particular

Although travel is not expected to be frequent, the Web and UI Developer should be able to occasionally meet onsite with clients and, if not located in the Washington, D.C. area, meet with the team for in-person planning sessions.

Qualifications

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or similar, or equivalent professional experience
  • At least 3 years experience as a web, UI, or UX developer
  • Understanding of user-centered design methods, including portfolio of sites you have designed or co-designed that demonstrate attention to user workflows in addition to static design
  • Experience with a major CMS, such as Wordpress, ideally in a multi-staged environment (testing, staging, production, etc.)
  • Fluency in best practices for information architecture and design
  • Experience with Jira or Pivotal Tracker
  • Strong written and verbal English communication skills

Desired Skills:

  • Past application development using React and/or Vue.js, preferably in the context of single-page applications
  • Practical experience performing user studies or documenting user workflows for implementation in web applications
  • AWS or Google Cloud experience
  • Experience in investment applications or working with the investment and/or financial industry

Interested?

Please apply by using the 'Apply' button.

Additional Information

RockCreek is a collaborative environment that values openness, transparency, partnership, and knowledge sharing. In a typical day you will interact with members of all of our teams; engineering is neither siloed nor cut off from the overall RockCreek business. You should be both interested and capable of learning the investment business as it relates to engineering, and creatively looking to enhance the overall RockCreek service offerings.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

title: Software engineer
description:
Want to touch the lives of millions of customers around the world, turning their digital customer journey into a fantastic ride? Then join our global engineering team.

Our apps are used by millions of customers all over the globe, multiple times a day. We’re looking for experienced software engineers who can help turn their digital journey into a fantastic ride.

We’re on a mission

More and more people live their lives on digital platforms. And although competition is fierce, this is where we want to be. We want to be part of people’s lives, helping them make better decisions. Become the go-to-place for their financial matters. What will this platform of ours look like? We’re building it right now. And that’s where you come in.

What you’ll be working on

We work on high-performing, scalable, innovative, multi-channel applications that make our customers smile with every interaction.

We have positions available in teams that are working to improve our mobile banking app, our internet banking web app, global continuous deployment pipelines, generic web components libraries, cross-channel employee portals and much more. We’d love to know in which ING team you’d like to add value.

As a full stack software engineer, you’ll work in an international environment in one of our multidisciplinary squads. Together with business colleagues, UX designers, visual designers and product owners you’ll be building our next generation banking applications.

What you’ll get in return

  • The chance to work in a global, innovation-driven company that loves tech.

  • An international and diverse network of the best engineering talents.

  • Many opportunities to test yourself, learn and grow.

  • An agile, vibrant and flexible work environment.

  • Great work-life balance.

  • A competitive salary and excellent benefits, like a 13th month, pension scheme, personal allowance, laptop, mobile phone.

What you bring

We’re looking for creative, open-minded junior, mid-level and senior engineers who:

  • Love solving technical and functional challenges.

  • Quickly grasp new technical concepts, also outside of their comfort zone.

  • Know what it’s like to work in multidisciplinary teams and embrace the agile way of working.

  • Have great analytical skills and conceptual / architectural understanding.

  • Follow software development trends and technology in general, and enjoy sharing what they know with the rest of the organisation.

  • Have strong social and communication skills (fluently speak and write English)

Your tech stack

  • A proven track record and proficiency in software development.

  • For back end think about JVM-based with a focus on Java, Spring, Maven, Jenkins, Sonar, Cassandra, Oracle.

  • For front end: Polymer, Angular, Web components, Redux, NPM.

  • Knowledge about databases, VMs, docker and cloud patterns are an advantage.

  • Experience with (test) automation, continuous delivery, deployment tools and pipelines. We work with Tomcat, Jenkins, Nolio, SonarQube, Fortify, Artifactory, Selenium among others.

Interested? Let’s chat

To find out more, hit the link! and share your CV. We’ll be in touch.

title: Web Application Developer/Drupal Developer
description:
At the Howard Hughes Medical Institute (HHMI), creativity and excellence are fundamental to our success. As one of the world's largest philanthropies, HHMI is a major force in advancing biomedical research and science education in the U.S. and beyond. We have an exciting opportunity for a web developer working in the Information Technology department at our Headquarters in Chevy Chase, Maryland. This is a full-time position.

At our headquarters, we provide space for collaboration and interaction beyond your office – sunlit rooms, artwork, beautiful grounds, gyms with classes, snacks, and, of course, smart people and innovative work all around…not to mention free coffee!

We invest in people, not projects. As such, the organization is committed to helping our employees grow. The development team has access to a variety professional development options including training programs, courses, and conferences, to name a few.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Reporting to the Senior Manager of Web Application Development, the web application developer must know Drupal inside and out with experience taking complex page designs and building out the required content types, frontend HTML/CSS/JS, and even writing custom modules as needed. The developer should be very familiar with commonly used Drupal modules, and understand the basic architecture for Drupal sites. Our clients appreciate high attention to detail when translating designs to code, so we prefer developers who have an eye for common user experience and design issues that crop up on both desktop and mobile implementations.

You will work alongside a skilled team of other web developers, and will collaborate with them on projects, following Agile/Scrum methodologies. Code reviews, quality assurance, and user-acceptance testing are all part of our process to ensure high caliber results.

Qualifications

Education:

BS degree in computer science, computer engineering, or information technology.

Experience:

2+ of hands-on experience with Drupal 7/8. 5+ years of web development experience. Strong fluency in PHP. Experience with source control systems, such as Git. Demonstrated proficiency of HTML/CSS/JS, with technologies such as LESS/SAAS, Bootstrap, Node/NPM/Gulp, and Angular/React. Experience with at least two other programming languages.

Please include links to source control or websites in your application to showcase your coding experience and skills.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
Vi søker utvikler til Telenor Software Lab Trondheim!

Elsker du å programmere og ser etter nye utviklingsmuligheter? Vil du være med å videreutvikle en tjeneste over en million mennesker bruker? Vi søker utvikler som ønsker og jobbe med den kjente skytjenesten "Min Sky"!

Informasjon om stillingen Telenor Software Lab i Trondheim utvikler Telenors tjeneste “Min Sky” for skylagring av bilder og video. Tjenesten har over en million brukere og er en sentral del av Telenors satsing på digitale tjenester. Telenor Software Lab er posisjonert for å levere flere slike tjenester, og utviklingsteamet er stadig i vekst.

Vi har et spennende fagmiljø der vi jobber med et bredt spekter av oppgaver, fra maskinlæring og bildegjenkjenning til utvikling av gode brukergrensesnitt. Det er fokus på brukeropplevelse, og vi gjennomfører undersøkelser ute blant faktiske brukere for å finne ut hva som fungerer.

Til sammen teller vi i dag 31 stk på kontoret, hvor vi har en flott variasjon i nasjonaliteter og aldre. Teamet du vil jobbe på består i dag av fire stk. Vi bruker scrum som arbeidsmetodikk, og jobber derfor både selvstendig og i team. I starten får du tett oppfølging og opplæring. Vi forventer ikke at du skal kunne alt fra før og hos oss får du hjelp til å kvalitetssikre ditt arbeid, når vi har daglige code-reviews.

Hos oss vil du ha påvirkningskraft og rom for å komme med forslag. På sikt kan du få mer ansvar, samt få muligheten til å lære flere teknologier om du ønsker det.

Vi tilbyr

  • Utviklingsmuligheter og egenutviklingsprogram tilpasset den enkelte ansatte
  • Spennende fagmiljø
  • Interessante og utfordrende oppgaver
  • Valgfritt verktøy/utstyr til arbeidet
  • Svært godt arbeidsmiljø og moderne lokaler
  • Goder som ekstra ferie, fri kantine, dekt andel av foreldrepermisjon, telefon/internett mm.
  • Konkurransedyktige vilkår
  • Fleksibel arbeidstid, med kjernetid fra 0930-1500

Arbeidsoppgaver

  • Videreutvikle Min Sky sine tjenester
  • Implementere nye features
  • Noe vedlikehold

Vi søker deg som

  • Erfaring med utvikling av skytjenester
  • Ferdigheter innen React og TypeScript
  • Fordel med relevant utdanning på høyskolenivå

Hos oss er dine personlige egenskaper like viktig som dine tekniske programmeringskunnskaper! Faktisk er det aller viktigste for oss at du virkelig liker å programmere, bryr deg om brukeropplevelser og har et ønske om å utvikle deg som utvikler. Når vi jobber i team er samarbeid en egenskap vi setter høyt, og vi ønsker gjerne deg som er fremoverlent og tørr å gjøre feil, samtidig som du er selvstendig og ansvarsfull.

Rekrutteringsprosessen utføres av Academic Work på vegne av Telenor. Ta kontakt med Mari Helland for spørsmål! Søknadsfrist 22.04.19!

Informasjon om bedriften Telenor Software Lab designer, utvikler og drifter digitale tjenester både for Telenor og direkte mot sluttkunder. Vårt største produkt er "Min Sky", en skylagringstjeneste for bilder og video. Tjenesten har over en million brukere og er en sentral del av Telenors satsing på digitale tjenester. Telenor Software Lab er posisjonert for å levere flere slike tjenester, og utviklingsteamet er stadig i vekst. Vi har i dag 31 ansatte og holder til på Brattørkaia i Trondheim.

title: FullStack Developer
description:
FullStack developer / DevOps

Metrological is quickly growing (inter-)nationally and therefore we are looking for expansion of our current team with a FullStack developer / DevOps.

What will you do?

  • The daily activities range from data modeling to implementation, from web sockets to server architecture and the resolution of possible production problems.
  • As a FullStack developer / Dev Ops you work with different techniques, such as NodeJS, Linux, Nginx, Redis, ElasticSearch, MySQL and AngularJS.

What we are looking for?

  • Bachelor or master’s degree in computer science or similar technical area is a must;
  • Relevant experience as a full stack developer / dev op is a must;
  • Extensive experience with Javascript, Linux en MySQL is a must;
  • Experience with NodeJS, Redis, nginx en ElasticSearch is a plus;
  • You have an excellent command of the English language, in word and in writing;
  • Furthermore, you are accurate, structured and a team player, who is able to work independently and take on responsibilities.

Our dedicated team working in a tech-challenging environment:

You will become a part of the development team (consisting of 40 dedicated team members, including App Developers, Testers, Graphic Designers and Backend / Framework Developers) and are responsible for the development and maintenance of all backend services for our TV Appstore and associated TV Applications.

The Appstore is continuously under development as we are glad to supply innovative products to our customers. In addition to innovation, the challenge lies mainly in the code-technical aspect and the maintenance of the cloud architecture. There is an extensive cloud architecture with> 99.99% uptime that serves more than 100TB of data per month worldwide and has to handle 2500 requests per second at peak times.

Why are we the best company to currently work?

  • Metrological is a very innovative and dynamic company in the TV industry.
  • The office is located in the heart of Rotterdam and can best be described as a modern and inspiring work environment with an informal but professional atmosphere.
  • With a close-knit team of over 60 young and ambitious employees, the company works daily on the (continued) development of the Appstore for TV operators.
  • Metrological is growing fast so the internal (growth) possibilities are virtually unlimited. We offer you a position in which you can relinquish your creativity and work on the product of the future. You work in an inspiring environment with the latest equipment, so you can get the best out of yourself.

Apply?

Do you want to contribute to the success of Metrological? Send your resume via this link and we get in touch with you within 2 working days.

title: Senior Backend PHP Developer (Laravel)
description:
Be a part of an exciting journey

At Cobiro we're using machine learning and AI to build the next generation of online advertising experiences. We're on a mission to make online marketing accessible, trivial and high-performing for everyone, and we're starting with Google Ads.

Working at Cobiro, you’ll join a flat and agile organisation where bright ideas are appreciated and implemented regardless of seniority or area of specialization. We’re ambitious and work hard, but also know how to let loose and celebrate our accomplishments. At Cobiro you will meet different nationalities and personalities. We have common denominators: We are self-starters and team-players, love to solve problems, and we create high quality solutions.

We offer:

  • Flexible working hours
  • An agile work environment
  • Focus on quality solutions
  • Options to attend relevant courses and conferences
  • A team of passionate, skilled and experienced colleagues
  • All the gear and food you need: breakfast on Fridays, lunch every day, sodas, sparkling water, fruit, vegetables, sweets...
  • Frequent social company activities, Friday bar included
  • Good working equipment
  • A great working location at Esplanaden, Central Copenhagen

PHP Backend Developer (Laravel)

You will join a company where quality is valued: We know it sometimes takes time creating something great, and even if we do have deadlines we prefer a good product to quick launching. This means, you will work independently and take responsibilities of your own projects, and you can use your knowledge and curiosity to build something great.

You will be joining a skilled tech team consisting of backend developers working within the Laravel framework. We practice daily stand-ups, 14 day sprints, and work within smaller teams. We can offer an agile working environment: we collaborate across departments as well, for example AI, QA, Frontend, or Product Management.

For this position, you will need:

  • Excellent PHP coding skills and solid experience in Laravel
  • Substantial PostgreSQL/MySQL experience
  • Experience with data integration, web services & APIs
  • Proficient in GIT, and knowledgeable of CI principles
  • Sharp analytical mind with the ability to break down requirements and problems into smaller pieces

title: Senior Full-stack Developer (Firebase, node, react)
description:
Mothership engineering team is working towards Exchange product release. You have an excellent opportunity to jump on-board and join us on this exciting journey. Here is the portrait of a person we’re looking for.

You agree that JavaScript has won the war, at least for now. It’s your favorite tool, and you mastered it while making apps and web servers for years. Your favorite front-end framework is React.js. You can use it in different variations depending on a task and a project size. You are an expert in node.js. You know it’s architecture, and you don’t hesitate to use a profiler to improve the performance of a service. You’re following best development practices. Your code is nice and clean, and you can be on the same page with your teammates about this.

You passed through times of manual deployments and now enjoy the era of Docker containers. However, you prefer to be serverless. Although you can spin up any services and self-manage them, you're more happy with using managed cloud solutions. You love Firebase. You can tell us at least a couple of stories how did it help you to solve a business problem in hours instead of days and weeks. You’re not trying to dump QA responsibility on someone else. You agree that testing is a developer’s responsibility. You are proud of your typical above 95% test coverage. You can organize CI/CD flow and push a constant stream of features and patches to a staging environment, then to the production.

We are all constantly learning, but that’s not your first reason for joining us. You come here, first and foremost, to add another solid mark in your track record of successful projects. You listen to business needs and can evaluate priorities. You don’t want to be micromanaged. You are feature and delivery oriented. You are keen to make a great product. If all the above is about you, please double check the requirements and responsibilities below, add your cover letter and apply.

Requirements:

Five years of production experience in apps and web servers development; Expert knowledge in node.js and react.js; Confident UI development with HTML and CSS; A track record of projects built with Firebase and other serverless tools; Experience building scalable APIs which is able to handle high-volume traffic; Experience working in a startup environment; A strong team player with excellent communication skills; Ability to hack things together quickly;

Responsibilities:

Improve, add new features and build new software solutions for Mothership; Design and implement APIs to integrate Mothership’s products with internal and external services; Optimize development process by bringing best practices and improving CI/CD pipeline; Own and deliver maintainable, well-tested code.

Apply on Lever - https://jobs.lever.co/mothership/e70325f2-f6c8-4111-a590-2ef1e1a2724d

title: Senior/Lead Backend Developer (m/f/d)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

As a (Senior) Backend Developer, you contribute to building the backend system of Taledo's platform, which includes development but also infrastructure tasks. You are a significant part of Taledo Team and you take initiative to support your colleagues’ and your own development process within the organization.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

You design, develop and maintain Taledo’s backend services/APIs. You build sustainable code and take full responsibility over parts of the backend infrastructure. You have direct impact on the product and you see your code used live within days after joining. You implement the product requirements and cover it by test cases. You may also have the possibility of working on frontend related tasks on a case-by-case basis. You directly report to and work with the CTO.

ABOUT YOU

Minimum 5 years of experience with Rails 4 and exposure to other relevant backend technologies Relevant university degree and solid track record of academic and professional and/or personal achievements. Thorough mindset, you never think in best cases. Efficient and pragmatic working style, mastering your IDE and tooling. Willingness to work in agile environment. Experience with HTML5, CSS and JS frameworks is a plus.

YOUR ENVIRONMENT

At Taledo you will work with a highly motivated team in a truly international atmosphere. We provide a professional environment that allows you to stay focused but also leaves room for creativity. Open and honest communication on all levels is important to us. We are always open to constructive feedback and expect the same from you. Knowledge sharing and constant learning are pillars of our culture hence we give you the opportunity to work on interesting side projects and develop your core or non-core competencies. We offer responsibility from the start in a flat hierarchy environment with a doer & maker mindset. We provide breakfast, sweet and salty snacks, fruits and drinks. We organize regular team events and keep the atmosphere in the office very casual and friendly. We have flexible working hours and offer additional vacation entitlement for every year you are part of Taledo. Our office and the team is pet friendly.

title: Linux and Network Cloud Systems Engineer
description:
ThinxNet is a young company from Munich, living the Internet of Things vision. With our product ryd, we’re able to connect cars with the internet in a simple and fast way. Given our system, consisting of a hardware plug and a smartphone app, customers can get mobile access to relevant on-board information of their automobiles, pay at the gas station with just one click on their smartphone – without lining up in the shop – and much more. In addition, consumers have the chance to collect ryd by participating in marketing campaigns. Later on, these bonus points can be converted to premiums. Our long-term goal is to create a completely new mobility experience within the connected car and furthermore making vehicles smarter than ever before.

Your tasks

  • Being responsible for the installation and maintenance of our Linux based servers and and container swarms
  • Supporting and monitoring the Linux environment as well as testing and troubleshooting of software and hardware problems in the environment
  • As part of the infrastructure team, analyze cloud architecture implementations and make recommendations regarding security, network design and storage utilization
  • Work with the team to automate management tasks, streamline processes and perform standard administration functions as needed

Your Qualifications

  • Solid experience with maintenance, monitoring, high availability and backups
  • Working knowledge in IT automation/orchestration software like SaltStack is a plus
  • Working knowledge of containerization solutions such as Docker and orchestration solutions such as Kubernetes is a plus

What we offer

  • Learn from our experienced team, investors and advisors
  • Attractive role in the development of our growing service
  • Competitive salary
  • Great workplace
  • No politics, quick decisions in a well-funded start-up

Ready to revolutionize the automotive industry?

Then submit your CV and a short note why and when you want to join us to jobs@thinxnet.com. If you have any questions, feel free to give us a call or just stop by at our office. We really look forward to getting to know you!

Contact

Christoph Geiser Head of Software Development

ryd.one |thinxnet.com | ThinxNet GmbH Blutenburgstr. 18 | 80636 München | Tel.: +49 89 4520663-0

Special Instructions for Headhunters (only):

  • This is a permanent position - no freelancers are currently considered.
  • Please carefully read the job description.
  • Please send the matching CVs to the relevant job advertisement.
  • We are happy to review anonymized CVs - we will get back to you if the CV is interesting. If not then please do not expect an answer.
  • Please only send CVs which match the job description. If a job is not posted here, then there is no need to send a CV or call.
  • If you are not a headhunter and happen to read this, but rather look for a job, then please ignore the above lines: we are happy to receive your call and we will for sure provide feedback on your application :-)

title: Front End Developer for new sustainability platform
description:
You are a Front End Developer wanting to join a small team and make a contribution to social and environmental impact at the same time as build a commercially successful company.

We are looking for a freelance developer to join our team developing the www.oneplanet.com platform. The company is a for-profit enterprise which has been set up by leading not-for-profit, Bioregional www.bioregional.com.

In order to take our platform to the next level, our User Interface Designer is creating many new UI design files. Before implementing these designs in the back-end of the platform, we need a front-end developer to take the ADOBE XD files and code them in HTML / CSS / Material UI static web pages.

Therefore, we are looking for a developer who has 2 or 3 years experience at least in coding clean HTML, CSS3, responsive design and who has also experience in using Photoshop or similar image editor tools in order to collaborate with our UI designer. You will also need to have some experience of working with existing libraries like Material UI or Bootstrap.

We work on European timezones but could have some flexibility. Initial contract will be for 6 months but will be extended for the right applicant.

We are an equal opportunities company and would particularly welcome applications from women developers.

Please send your CV and short covering note to richard.edwards@oneplanet.com along with your remuneration expectation. Please state country in which you are based.
how_to_apply: Please email you CV with a couple of sentences on why you want to join our team, to richard.edwards@oneplanet.com

title: Java developer / DevOps Engineer
description:
Heb jij (ruime) ervaring met applicatie ontwikkeling, testen en onderhoud en ben jij toe aan een nieuwe uitdaging? Kom jij als ervaren engineer te werken voor ons Agile Devops team dat zich bezig houdt met business kritische applicaties?

CGI heeft voor haar locatie in Rotterdam een vacature voor een Java developer / DevOps Engineer

Wat ga je doen als Jave Developer / DevOps Engineer? Als ervaren DevOps applicatie engineer houd jij je bezig met het vertalen van stakeholder requirements (functionele en niet-functionele) naar functioneel/technisch ontwerp en naar test ontwerp. Jij ontwikkelt applicatie- en test software (ontwerp, bouw en test). Daarnaast automatiseer jij systeem- en integratie testen (voorbereiden, uitvoeren en beheer/onderhoud) en voer jij applicatie onderhoud en support uit. Het oplossen van incidenten en waakdienst kan onderdeel zijn van de opdracht.

Wat breng je mee

  • Je bent analytisch sterk en denkt in oplossingen. Ook ben je proactief en resultaat gedreven. Je hebt ruime ervaring met agile werken en werkomgeving. Je hebt goede communicatieve vaardigheden en een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal. Daarnaast heb je:
  • Ervaring met Java, SQL, Automatisch test scripting, System administratie (Unix/Linux); 3 tot 5 jaar ervaring in Java software development en met test ervaring.

Het is een pré als je ook ervaring hebt met: Java Web Services, Soap or Rest, Perl, Relational database (MySQL), JMeter, Atlassian Jira (voor Agile board) en Confluence (wiki), Jenkins and Docker (voor build en deployment automatisering).

Waar kom je terecht Als ervaren DevOps applicatie engineer kom jij te werken in het marktsegment Communications dat zich richt op alle grote telecom en mediabedrijven in Nederland. We leven in een wereld vol informatie waarin alles en iedereen is verbonden. Technologische vooruitgang en veranderend consumentengedrag hebben de bedrijfsomgeving voor de telecomindustrie veranderd. Het tempo waarin dit verandert ligt hoog. Het bieden van toegang tot communicatienetwerken is niet meer genoeg.

Binnen onze sector helpen we telecombedrijven in hun transformatie naar leveranciers van (digitale) belevingen. Al ruim 20 jaar zijn we actief in de (tele)communicatie industrie waarin we samen werken met toonaangevende bedrijven. Hierdoor kennen we de business én uitdagingen van telecom- en mediabedrijven en koppelen we dit aan onze IT-expertise. Samen met de andere professionals zet je in op service transities naar nieuwe diensten en werkwijzen (agile, lean), en netwerk transities (cloud based).

We willen het beste uit jou halen Wanneer je bij CGI gaat werken kom je terecht op een uitdagende werkvloer met professionele collega’s en ben je de bouwsteen binnen een hechte community. We stimuleren je in jouw ontwikkeling en bieden je hiervoor alle ruimte. Doorgroeien is vanzelfsprekend.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten: Bouw met ons aan je carrière Het is een bijzondere tijd binnen de wereld van IT, de digitale transformatie zit in een versnelling. CGI heeft een schat aan kennis en praktische ervaring op het gebied van digitale transformatie. Zo helpen wij onze klanten belangrijke stappen te zetten op de weg naar hun digitale transformatie en bieden we onze professionals uitdagende carrièremogelijkheden.

Ons succes is gebaseerd op het talent en de betrokkenheid van onze professionals. Samen, als één team, staan we voor de uitdagingen en delen we de beloningen die gepaard gaan met de groei van CGI. Dit versterkt het gevoel van eigenaarschap, want al onze professionals delen mee in de waarde die wij gezamenlijk creëren.

Kom werken bij CGI én bouw samen met ons aan een van de grootste, onafhankelijke, IT en zakelijke dienstverleners ter wereld.

title: Full Stack Web Developer
description:

Some of the companies we’ve partnered with include StockX, Emagine Entertainment, University of Michigan, Rock Ventures, Rocket Fiber, and the Detroit Regional Chamber, just to name a few.

title: Senior / Senior Staff Android Engineer
description:
Matterport is a 3D immersive media SaaS company that makes it easy for anyone to quickly and inexpensively create a digital 3D model of any physical space. Our 3D immersive media platform is used across many industries to improve how people make decisions about properties. We are the world leader in the category we invented, having built digital models of over 1.5 million properties so far!

Starting with residential real estate, where 8% of all homes sold in the US last year had a Matterport 3D tour, the company has changed how people experience physical spaces. Our product offering is selling exponentially in new markets like apartments, vacation rentals, hotels, event venues, insurance, retail environments, as well as in architecture, engineering, and construction.

We have an end-to-end system for crafting, experiencing, and changing cloud-based immersive 3D models of real spaces. Our system improves the way people experience and visualize physical spaces making it incredibly fun and practical for users to move through real world spaces as if they were there.

We just closed $48 M in Series D revenue last month and were selected as the one of the fastest growing Bay Area private companies based on our year-to-year revenue growth!

We are seeking a Senior Android Software Engineer to help lead development for our 3D technology. We are working with partners to deliver state of the art capture experiences on next generation mobile and camera devices. Are you passionate about building phenomenal mobile software and motivated to take the lead in the creation of mobile apps for capturing, editing, and viewing 3D spaces and objects? If yes, please reach out to us!

Responsibilities:

Collaborate closely with the engineering team and product marketing to define, design, develop, and deliver new exciting features on Matterport’s capture applications Continuously explore, evaluate, and incorporate new technology into our products and processes to improve development efficiency Deliver a quality software solution using the Agile mobile development cycle Analyze business requirements, provide development estimates, feedback and proper implementation Develop, maintain, support, monitor and optimize existing mobile applications Research and recommend new mobile tools and applications

Requirements:

6+ years experience in high performance software development 2+ experience in Android mobile development experience with deep technical knowledge of mobile frameworks and how to build great reactive UI design You have a solid grasp of core software concepts, including networking, storage/file system, security, memory management, multi-threading, and application lifecycle management You are a thoughtful co-worker, enjoyable to work with, yet able to work independently with minimal supervision in a collaborative work environment.

Desired Skills:

3D graphics, odometry, photogrammetry knowledge Optimizing for performance on mobile (CPU/GPU/memory/latency) Experience working with embedded Android Experience working with RESTful web APIs BS or MS in Computer Science or similar field

title: Contract Part Time - New Mobile App Development
description:
GENERAL OVERVIEW

This is a unique contract and part time position. You will be developing a brand new mobile app AND also teaching a new young programmer at the same time. Plan on 10-15 hours per week. All work can be done remotely except that the training will be need to occur in time with Eastern Time. Pay is $50 per hour.

APPLICATION SPECIFICS

The app to be developed will work on phones and tablets. The specific details of the program are confidential, but the work involves coordinating and syncing multiple devices' cameras and sending the feed to a single tablet. The app will be an entire platform that will eventually turn into a paid platform. Currently we expect the initial version will be written only in Swift for iOS. Then we will expand the platform to work on Andriod after we create the MVP. The app has been wireframed and a decent amount of the specifications are prepared.

We will use Trello to track development tasks.

If all goes well then this MVP will become an app that can turn into its own application with theoretical revenues of $1 million+ per month. Of course if the MVP does take hold then we will grow the team to for more intense and rapid development.

TRAINING SPECIFICS

You will be asked to work with a young student programmer to teach this programmer and assign small tasks to him. You will be doing code review and essentially mentoring this programmer. You will need to be the main driver of the development. The young programmer has an understanding of coding basics and has completed an online Udemy course on Swift.

GROWTH POTENTIAL

If the initial development goes well and the reaction to the MVP is positive then there is a potential to convert this development into a full time salaried position.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

  • At least 1 year swift development with experience building and deploying an app to the Apple App Store
  • WIllingness and ability to work with a junior programmer who is learning, even at the expense of speed of development
  • Ability to devote 10-15 hours per week.
  • Ability to own all aspects of app development including the front end, back end, database, etc.
  • Ability to spend 2-3 hours per day during the week working with the junior programmer
  • We do expect you have other work and can be flexible to allow you to pursue other projects.

OTHER SUPPORT

  • We have other developers on other projects who can jump in to assist, particularly with server setup and general programming problems
  • We have a Product Visionary who can answer all specification and requirements questions.

WHEN APPLYING

  • Send us your experience in Swift (and other languages and development tools and systems)
  • If you have any limitations or requirements that we need to consider please include it in your submission.
  • We expect you will have your own computer and other equipment.

Thank you!

title: Tech Lead (m/f/d)
description:
We are looking for a Tech Lead to join our team in Munich. You’re interested in further optimizing and automating the technical integration of our partner shops and delivering high quality software is your number one priority? Then Stylight is your place to be.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Ensuring your team ships quality products and code in accordance with business needs.
  • Build, maintain, and monitor our scalable architecture. We take pride in building highly performant and failure resistant platforms with a small team.
  • Own services from design, development, and testing to continuous integration, monitoring, and support.
  • Enjoy what you do, and be ready to research and learn new technologies.
  • Explain technical topics to non-technical colleagues and advocate for your team across the company.
  • Mentor, lead, and support a team of 3-5 engineers to foster technical excellence in the team. Bring your best practices, challenge the status quo, and set things in motion.

Background Of Successful Applicants

  • You bring hands-on experience in software development, ideally 5+ years and have experience in designing, building and operating complex, scalable systems.
  • You have significant Python experience and are ready to share what you’ve learned with others.
  • You want to take responsibility and ownership for the software you produce. “You build it, you run it!” is our general philosophy.
  • You are opinionated and outspoken on engineering best practices, but can still maintain friends.
  • You have solid experience with both relational and NoSQL databases.
  • You have proficient English skills and are able to communicate honestly and openly with your colleagues.
  • You’re excited to work in an environment where collaboration, continuous integration and delivery are as vital as morning coffee.
  • Experience with Docker, AWS, and microservice architectures are a very nice plus.

The Business Development Tech Team

  • Is responsible for automating and continuously improving the technical integration tools and systems used by our business and finance teams as well as hundreds of business partners.
  • Codes primarily in Python (mostly for backend applications) and Javascript (for interactive UIs) and is committed to the quality and health of their codebase.
  • Works in an agile and cross-functional environment alongside our sales and partner managers.
  • Enjoys autonomous work as well as pair programming, code reviews and learning together.

Why join Stylight?

  • Stylight is #1 Meetup organizer in Munich, and deeply involved in the local tech community.
  • We organize daho.am, our own annual developer conference. Top-notch speakers and over 1,000 attendees.
  • International & highly motivated environment with open business culture in all departments. Our company language is English.
  • Hands-on work after quick ramp up & openness to new solutions and improvements.
  • A personal development budget is given to you to use throughout the year for personal growth.
  • We are family-friendly and enjoy spending time with one another outside of working hours from board game evenings and BBQs to ping pong tournaments and Christmas tree decorating.
  • We have one of the coolest office spaces in Munich (and actually in Germany) in the city-center, and just a 10-minute walk to the nearest Biergarten.
  • Want to know more? Check out: about.stylight.com and blog.stylight.com // tech.stylight.com.

Up for the challenge?

If you want to work in a fun, exciting, challenging and dedicated environment, then don't hesitate and apply today via about.stylight.com/jobs. We're looking forward to reading your complete application (Cover letter, CV, references and certificates) in English or German! Your contact: Carina Meyer.

title: Senior Java Developer
description:
As a Senior Developer at Publicis Sapient you will design and develop technology based business solutions for our client in the power industry. You will see the “big picture” and create software design and guide the development team during implementation. You will be responsible for the technical direction of projects, software structure, frameworks, and algorithms. You will be empowered to drive innovation by coming up with new and exciting ideas to creatively solve issues, as well as proactively look for opportunities to improve the design, interface, and architecture of the products. You will enable the team to leverage industry standard frameworks, coding practices and development tools.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: -Understand functional and non-functional requirements and elicit business solutions -Evaluate solution options and lead solution design using best practice/design patterns -Estimate and plan tasks for the solution -Take ownership of the solution from end to end, and be responsible for translating functional requirements into a solution

REQUIRED SKILLS: -Strong development background with latest Architecture trends, Java/Java EE Technologies Spring, -Hibernate, Spring Boot, Design Patterns, Object Oriented Programming Concepts -Experience of Micro-Services solution development and delivery, experience with APIs design and development -Experience of design and implementation of external services integrations (using REST, SOAP and/or ESB) -Strong background using various libraries, framework and patterns in Java technology stack -Experience in Solution architecture -Solution cross-cutting concerns (security, monitoring, caching, etc.) -Prepare detailed design specifications -Develop/invent highly innovative, complex and critical solutions -Prior experience with agile development, continuous delivery, and DevOps -Build & release management using technologies like Maven and Gradle, Continuous Integration like Hudson, Jenkins, Source code management using GIT -Experience developing front-end using technologies like SWING, Spring MVC, AJAX, HTML, JavaScript, CSS -Strong experience in one or more Relational Databases like Oracle, MS SQL Server designing normalized or de-normalized database, writing complex SQL queries & stored procedures and analyzing & performance optimization -Experience in profiling an application to troubleshoot issues, monitoring system performance (CPU, memory, processes, threads, network etc.) -Knowledge of Power market with technical and business landscape, industry standard market systems behavior will be a plus

OTHER QUALITIES: -Experience in working with globally distributed team across North America and India -Excellent communication skills to effectively and clearly communicate across functional and technical teams -Excellent problem solving skills -Self-motivated, energetic, organized, driven and result oriented -Take initiatives and work independently without constant supervision -High attention to detail and commitment to quality

ACADEMIC QUALIFICATION: -Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field
